description.narrative: CECOHAS is a non-profit civil society organization based in the Municipality of Quelimane, Zambézia Province, whose mission is to contribute to the strengthening of vulnerable populations through the promotion of access to safe water for all, hygiene andbasic sanitation, particularly Women and children. CECOHAS specializes in WASH, with 14 years of experience and recognized for its contribution in access to water, hygiene promotion and basic sanitation in Zambezia Province and at national level. CECOHAS's position in the WASH context is the result of Oxfam's investments and successful initiatives with projects funded by WaterAid - Mozambique, COSV - Italian Cooperation, French Embassy, USAID, among others. The purpose of CECOHAS in this initiative isto contribute to the promotion of access to safe water for the target communities in Chemba district of Sofala Province and to contribute to the reduction of diseases of water and environmental origin and other diseases caused by bad sanitation and associated with climate change. CECOHAS has the capacity and tools of administrative and financial management and has wide experience in the execution of projects based in the community.

participating-org.narrative:
CECOHAS (Coordination Center for Water and Sanitation Hygiene) is a national NGO, founded on 10.12.2002, with the purpose of promoting improved and sustainable technologies and cost-effective in the family sector and sustainable community development, linked to the sector water and sanitation.
Believe in the ideals of the founding members, was constructed this great dream, which today has become a reality, where you can meet in accordance with its objectives and minimum standards of care your target group and contribute to the resolution of the problems that contribute for the backwardness in economic and socio-cultural development of the country.
The history of CECOHAS the route should be viewed with one eye to see well and respect, where its members, friends and partners must comply with all possible care and giving their valid contributions. The Story of this Organization, was made low of great sacrifice and above all, a lot of will and delivery of its members, so that we must be reflected at all times taking into account all these factors have been overcome to get where we are today.
The Organization of the statutes is the mother document, which ensures the great changes at the political level of the Organization. All important decisions that can change something, can not be made without thebrief consultation of 1/3 of the members.
Strategic Objective
Contribute to the strengthening of vulnerable populations to ensuretheir right in conditions of access to safe water, hygiene and adequate sanitation through the provision of direct services and advocacy actions.
Note: In CECOHAS, we believe that the Mozambican people have the right of safe water and adequate sanitation as a basic human right and considers it from minimum care standards (ESFERA) within the internal objectives and partnerships with other organizations and the Government.
